speakers.name: JUSTICE KAGAN
speakers.text: Mr. Cohn, what if I think that TSA might have reacted differently to what was actually said and to what really should have been said?  Would they have reacted either way, they should have done something either way, but they would have done a different kind of thing?  What if I think that?  What does that suggest about the proper resolution of this case?

speakers.name: CHIEF JUSTICE ROBERTS
speakers.text: Thank you, counsel. The case is submitted.
